name: The Haunting of Bartholomew
description:
The Haunting of Bartholomew

You are a ghost, doomed to haunt the town of Bartholomew for eternity.

There is no moving on, no returning to life. Nobody can see you; nobody can hear you.

But after years long practice, you can pick up a pen...

A tale of death and the monotony of life, with loss of love and faith, and the instability that can come from solitude. 

You died in the 1930's. Sixty years on, you still roam Bartholomew. Can you find the humour in your situation, or are you in misery? Are you furious at the world, or do you get by with apathetic pessimism? Perhaps you have gone a little mad - nobody would blame you.

~~~

You are alone in your world - but not in this town:

The pastor, Nicole, is depressed but utterly devoted to her faith - for now.

Paige is a bully, plain and simple. She crashes her car and joins you in limbo, but will death change her?

When Christian buys a new house, he expects a fresh start. For you, his arrival is a shock: you loved someone once, when you lived - and this newcomer is, without any doubt, their descendant.

Nicole, Paige, and Christian will all have their own routes, which can be either antagonistic, platonic, or romantic. There will also be a loner path. There will be no happy endings, however. At least, not in the traditional sense - and the relationships, in whichever form chosen, will manifest entirely through feelings and written communication.

 ~~~

Warning – The Haunting of Bartholomew will contain the following subjects and themes, and this list will be updated as necessary throughout development:

Death

Depression

PTSD

Mental illness

Suicidal thoughts and discussions of suicide

Discussions of amputation
